Ingredients.3: 0.5 tablespoons seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®)

Ingredients.8: 1 tablespoon malt vinegar, or to taste

Directions.1: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with aluminum foil; spray with cooking spray.

Directions.2: Mix oil, seafood seasoning, onion powder, hot sauce, and garlic powder together in a bowl.

Directions.3: Cut potatoes into spirals using a spiralizer fitted with a large shredder blade; snip long spirals into smaller lengths.

Directions.4: Place potatoes into a large bowl; drizzle with oil mixture. Toss until potatoes are evenly coated.

Directions.5: Spread coated potatoes in a single layer onto the baking sheets, leaving 1/4-inch of space between potato spirals.

Directions.6: Bake in the preheated oven until bottom of potatoes are browned, 8 to 9 minutes. Flip potatoes with a spatula. Bake until potatoes are browned and crisp on top, about 6 minutes.

Directions.7: Sprinkle malt vinegar and sea salt over potatoes.
